text: - Our organization is focused

on bringing together
modern science in medicine
with the world's top doctors
to really give our members

the leading preventative
medicine practice.
We've been partnering with GoML

to fundamentally build
a clinical data platform

that takes all of the
imaging data that we have,
all the lab data that we have,

all of the exams that our
different specialists are doing,
and combine all of that information

into a clinical data
platform that allows us
to derive insights on our members
and allows our doctors to run
the different clinical programs
that they're seeking to build.
Now, our doctors are able to, for example,
ask our clinical data platform

to help identify
cardiovascular risk factors,

and they're triangulating
results from labs
with insights from our imaging,

with exam results for specialist
insights from doctors,
both within our organization and outside.
And they're doing that all
in a way that would be impossible to do

with the traditional healthcare
stack that exists today.
And then we're also using

the set of foundational
services like EC2 and S3
and so forth to be able to store
the information that we have

and to be able to aggregate
all the data that we have.
Our partnership with GoML and AWS
has allowed our doctors to be able to tap

into the broad set of clinical
information that we have,
and then deliver for our members

confidence that we have all
the preventative diseases
that we're able to identify,

and that we're able to
set them up for success
in terms of an optimized health span

across every different
area of their health.
For our doctors, we're reducing the time
that they spend on mundane tasks.
The time reduced in doing that

and the ability to collect
a much broader set of data
and incorporate that into the summaries
they're providing for our patients

is a huge part of the
outcome that they're driving.
(upbeat music)
